alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 26 at 8:05PM CST until December 27 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW AND MIXED PRECIPITATION INTO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... .A potent winter system will move across Minnesota and western Wisconsin tonight and into Monday morning with a variety of different winter impacts. The heaviest snow is expected in parts of central Minnesota with 5 to 7 inches likely. The heaviest snow rates are expected this evening. Wind gusts could lead to some patchy blowing snow. Farther south, snowfall amounts are expected to be more in the 2 to 5 inch range. The snow will mix with or change to freezing drizzle across most of the area late tonight. Ice accumulation of less than a tenth of an inch can be expected. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Douglas County. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
